page.title: 12Shopping in Bristol
page.content: At present very large supermarkets are springing up around the outskirts of Bristol. To be able to visit these "Super stores" Bedminster shoppers need to have transport as none of them is within walking distance of this neighbourhood. If sufficient customers are attracted to the superstores small local shops will not be able to compete and will close down. What will happen to those shoppers who do not have a car? We wondered who uses our local shops and whether they used supermarkets or superstores as well. We conducted a survey among 82 shoppers at a small local shop about where, how and why they shopped. The results are printed on the next page ("Shopping Survey, Bristol")
